more.title: How the Skeleton of Mutapa Times is Based on Sarah Charlesworth's Work

more.title: Woman Arrested After Selling Mt Pleasant House And Depositing US$480K In Botswana
more.description: Harare Woman Arrested For Depositing US$48OK In Botswana After Selling Mt Pleasant House A Harare woman is in deep trouble after she allegedly sold her plush Mount Pleasant home and attempted to spirit away nearly three-quarters of the cash to Botswana, flouting the country’s exchange control laws. Sixty-five-year-old Evelyn Sarah Bengesa appeared before Harare regional magistrate [...]The post Woman Arrested After Selling Mt Pleasant House And Depositing US$480K In Botswana appeared first on iHarare News.

more.title: Zimbabwe loses to India to record second T20 World Cup defeat
more.description: The Zimbabwe senior men’s cricket team suffered their second consecutive defeat at the ongoing ICC Men’s T20 World Cup after losing by 72 runs to hosts India on Thursday at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. The Chevrons put up a spirited fight but were ultimately outplayed by India, who posted a formidable total of [...]The post Zimbabwe loses to India to record second T20 World Cup defeat appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: UK connects Zimbabwean farmers with UK and European buyers
more.description: (Harare) – Eight buyers from the United Kingdom and European Union will visit 11 Zimbabwean farm and food businesses that have primed their horticulture products for exports through their work with the International Trade Centre (ITC). The trade mission is organised by the UK Trade Partnerships (UKTP) Programme, funded by the UK government and implemented by ITC.

more.title: Zimbabwe Govt Fires Back At Doctors Over Rejected US$367M US Health Aid Package
more.description: Zimbabwe Govt Responds After Doctors Urge Re-Engagement With US Over Rejected US$367M Health Aid Package A furious Zimbabwean government has accused the country’s top public health physicians of being “out of order” for intervening in an explosive diplomatic standoff with the United States over a rejected US$367 million (approximately R6.8 billion) health aid package.
